course.subject: MGMT
course.name: Introduction to Management
course.description: This course provides students with a systematic approach to acquiring a solid foundation in the principles and current practices of management. The focus of the course is about the interaction between individuals (managers) and the organization. We will explore what managers do through discussion of the four fundamental functions of managers, namely planning, organizing, leading and controlling. Topics include: evolution of management theories, environmental influences on management, organizational culture, strategic management, organizational design, change management, organizational control and human resources management.

reviews.author: Na
reviews.comment_content: Concepts are simple and easy to understand as they exist in real life.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof is kind and eager to create a good atmosphere for learning by asking questions. He loves students sharing their personal story and apply it to course concept. One interesting spot is that you can always see him holding a coffee to the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term: 25% (MC&2/3 short essays)
Final: 30%  (MC&2/3 short essays)
Participation: 10% (attendance+answering questions)
Quiz: 5% (5 in-class quizzes)
Project: 30%
reviews.comment_workload:
medium workload. Just remember to attend the class and be engaged in the interaction.

Exam: Understand the concept and memorize the term used in the ppt would be fine!

Quiz: each quiz has 5 MCs about the assigned reading. You can read it before the class.

Project: 5ppl in a group and you have to find the groupmates by yourself. Each group would be assigned to watch one episode of Undercover Boss and the aim is to link it to the course concept and present it in class.

reviews.author: 番茄薯仔湯
reviews.title: Work hard if you met pig teammates
reviews.comment_content:
See other

I studied another course MGMT1130, that one is easier and less content. There are a lot of concepts in this course so you have to memorize more.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor is very passionate and engaging in teaching, sometimes he even jumps LOL
Since he was in the consulting field, he gives a lot of down-to-earth examples and he is very smart. I like him but one downside is his accent. Sometimes it is very hard to catch and It takes time to 習慣
reviews.comment_grading:
For my class, class is not competitive, it is not hard to get a chance to answer the question. Yet, the questions asked by prof are not easy and it needs time to digest and answer. If you don't want to speak up in class and want A-range, don't reg this course.

Class Participation 10%
Group Presentation  25%  
Mid-term  30%
Final  35%

Participation: unknown (I speak up at least 1 time per class & prof remembers me)
Project: 80/100 (median:88 SD:9.55)
Midterm exam: 89/100
Final exam: 100/100
Final grade: A
* see other comments for SD & median

If I got full parti, my final score would be 91.7%
Very good grading considering my shit project

My advice to get good grades:
1. Speak up in class (If possible, don't talk shit and give quality comments)
2. Spend time on your cheat sheet (I spend 1X hours on writing all the content in lectures)
3. Write as many as possible even you are not sure about your answers on your exam (I don't think I give 100% accurate answers but they mark lenient)
4. Start your project earlier
reviews.comment_workload:
Chill
Just go to class answer questions and do the project
We could not choose our own teammates and good luck if you met pig teammate like me

He will give you a card when you answer his questions and I guess he would adjust a little bit on the scores in terms of the quality of answer you gave

reviews.author: Anonymous user
reviews.comment_content:
As its name suggests, it is an introduction course of management, so you will expect some parts of the content to be based on common sense, such as "external factors affecting business environment" and "why do planning". Moreover, as a Year 2 business student, I had the advantage because some chapters of this course are identical to MGMT 2110. These include 4 functions of management (planning, organising, leading and controlling); bias of decision making (e.g. halo effect); motivation; leadership.
   There is a group project, where a group of 6 students watch an episode of Undercover Boss, analyse management issues exist in that particularly company, then give recommendations in a 15-minute presentation. A 5-minute Q&A follows, where your group will probably be challenged by the prof and the class.
   In both exams, there are MC questions which are mostly based on management concepts, and a few short essay questions, based on business cases (in which you need your common sense) and management concepts.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Li is a very nice and approachable person. Him, the TA Peter and my project advisor were always willing to help. Prof Li is also quite diligent, as he marked many of the exam essay problems.
    However, it is also true that the teaching atmosphere is boring, especially because my section starts on Monday 09:00. Although the prof did try to making the course more interesting by adding many case analyses and fun video clips, I bet a number of students didn't pay attention.
    Besides, since the prof places emphasis on participation, many students were eager to respond. The downside is that quite some of the responses were repetitive but the prof still kept allowing 10 students to answer the same question, and this affected the class progress.
reviews.comment_grading:
The following is my score breakdown:
Class participation (10%) (50 points /500)
- The prof placed high emphasis on class interactions, but according to the TA, a low quality response might not be given marks.
- iPRS will be taken at the end of each class, and at the beginning of classes during presentation period.
- Students were advised not to use laptops.
- Attendance
- Participation

Group presentation (30%) (150 points)
- Presentation score: mean of 83.5 and highest of 95
- Peer evaluation: full score 16

Mid-term (30%) (150 points)
- MC: mean: 21.5, high: 26
- Essay: mean: 20.5, high 24

Final exam (30%) (150 points)
- MC: mean: 25.6, high: 30
- Essay: mean: 25.5, high: 28

As you can see, the score was quite competitive because the content was manageable and also there were quite some business students. However, the grading should be lenient as I managed to attain an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignments
Only one group presentation (but no report needed), but the project advisor (who is a Masters / PhD student) will guide you through

reviews.author: Lemonwong
reviews.title: Recommended CC course for all School student
reviews.comment_content:
Very basic concepts and knowledge of management, i.e. different structures of a company, what are the motivations to work, what are the distraction when making a decision. The materials are easily understood, do not require any pre-knowledge of business, so you don't necessarily listen to the instructor, read notes by yourself is enough for mid term and exam.
Most of the student are from RMBI and exchanges, though I am from Engineering school and I still have no trouble in comprehending the course. Just be reminded that there is a case study group project. Better to be enrolled with friends, otherwise, you will be isolated and seems "freeride" because your group mates are likely to be professional in the business.
reviews.comment_teaching: Since my class is at 900am so most of the time I just slept in the class (Attendance-_-) You often need to discuss with your project group mates about the assigned questions but ya, I just slept anyway. You also need to hand in a card for the instructor for recognizing so he knows you have participated in class when answering his question.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% IPRS and class participation
30% Group presentation
30% Midterm
30% Final
The midterm and final both contain about 30 MCs and three long question that you have to read a passage first. Basically, you just need to recite and fill everything taught in the notes and you will get high marks. The mean is relatively high though, around 25/28.
You don't need to worry about the long question, just use the concepts taught and blindly link into the passage, this way you will get full marks ( I get full marks in midterm in longQ, but I'm totally 9 write)
About the group presentation, it will be a case study of a movie about the management problems raised in a company, there wil be a PG student lead you to conduct. I didn't participate much so can't give much advice.
reviews.comment_workload: Apart from the group project, you only need to answer some question to let the instructor feels like you are here, but neglectable if you are not aiming for A or A+. Soft workload.

reviews.author: cindychow
reviews.comment_content:
- Introduction to Strategic Management
- External Analysis & Internal Analysis
- Strategy Formulation Tools
- Organizational Design & Strategy Implementation
- Introduction to Organisational Behaviour & Personality
- Learning & Decision Making
Motivation
- Human Resource Management
- Leadership
- Culture & Diversity

Basic concepts with application examples. It doesn't go too deep, and you can just pay some attention in class to understand all of them. It doesn't require any business-related background knowledge.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Three instructors, Baihe, Sherry and Leo.
They are responsible for different sections and different styles of teaching. Fair enough.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance 5%
Class Participation 5%
Assignments 10%
Presentation 25%
Final Examination 50%
Peer Evaluation 5%

People who would like to take this course, need to be aware of your attendance. Not only attending the class but also attending on time lol. Cuz in summer, there is one attendance taken by the quiz offered in the first 10 mins of the class.

For the assignments, in the summer semester, there is around one assignment per week (total of 4). It is a reflection of what you have learnt in the previous week's lecture, and it doesn't require you to go so deep to analyse those concepts. Just pay attention to the class, and write something that makes sense.

For the presentation, a group of three ppl is formed. In the summer semester, either you have some very hard-working teammates, or you have some don't give a f of grades teammates, just good luck with that.  It is just a review of one of the episodes of Undercover Boss, not difficult.

Final Exam, pay attention in class and easy peasy, mc and 2 LQ, you don't even need to work hard to memorise all of the concepts
reviews.comment_workload:
Just attend the classes and pay attention. Then, give like ~10-30mins for the assignments per week. It is more than enough to get a good grade in most of the parts.

And if you have good teammates, the workload from the presentation is much lower.

reviews.author: Trainer
reviews.title: Average Course
reviews.comment_content: Same with the previous part. Boring content and as a business student, you should study all of this in MGMT 2110.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In this course, there are totally 3 instructors (Baihe, Leo, Sherry) who are final year PHD student and have a first trial in teaching a course. Indeed, they all did a great job especially clarify the problem.

Both instructors are nice and willing to chat with us during the break.
reviews.comment_grading:
5% attendance
5% class participation
5% peer evaluation
10% assignment
25% presentation
50% final exam
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
50% exam is too heavy for us and presentation should have more weighting. Not yet release grade
reviews.comment_workload: Normal Summer sem workload

reviews.author: Angelsss
reviews.title: Easy course if u attend every lecture
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1: Foundation and history of management  
Topic 2: Managing the external environment  
Topic 3: Organizational culture  
Topic 4: Decision making  
Topic 5: Planning and strategy  
Topic 6: Organizational structure  
Topic 7: Motivation  
Topic 8: Leadership  
Topic 9: Controlling

Quite simple but boring.
reviews.comment_teaching: He tried to give a lot of real-life experiences which are quite useful for you to understand the concept. But make sure you have to stay awake in his lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class participation is very important. You have to answer questions so as to get participation marks. He encourages every student to answer question so dun be afraid if you are not sure about the answer. Almost every student can gain at least 70% of attendance.

Fair.
reviews.comment_workload: Very low. Only group project, mid-term and final.

reviews.author: Philosophy_Cat
reviews.title: Viewing the course with an introverted mindset
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1: Info and history
Topic 2: External environment
Topic 3: Organisational culture
Topic 4: Decision-making
Topic 5: Planning
Topic 6: Organising
Topic 7: Motivation
Topic 8: Leadership
Topic 9: Control

I only attended one lecture and didn't register the course. To avoid altering the average score of the reviews I am choosing 'A', 'B', 'B' and 'B' respectively for Content, Teaching, Grading and Workload.

Though I didn't register the course, I think I am still eligible to express my opinions regarding the only lecture I attended. At the beginning of the lecture, students were required to put a name tag on their desks. Since I am not used to this practice, it feels like the name tag on a dog dish. I also observed that the professor was very passionate and engaging, while some students were very active in answering his questions (probably due to the 10% class participation in the grading scheme, or their extroverted personalities rooted in their genes), which made me very uncomfortable.

Have you ever heard of the story of Sisyphus in Greek mythology? Sisyphus was punished by Hades to roll an immense boulder up a hill only for it to roll down every time it neared the top, repeating this action for eternity. Well, my feeling for this course is similar to Sisyphus.

If you are an introvert like me who hopes for an easy A-range, you should think thrice before registering this course since class participation is critical to your final grade; but if you are an extrovert and like to talk shit all day long, you are good to go.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very passionate and engaging in teaching, which could be good and bad at the same time.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Participation 10%
Group Presentation  25%  
Mid-term  30%
Final  35%

I guess the grading is good since I didn't register the course. You should however pay attention to the 10% class participation.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is extremely light for me since I didn't register the course. The only workload for me is probably rolling a rock up a hill for 1 hour and 20 minutes.

reviews.author: King527
reviews.title: An interesting course
reviews.comment_content:
This course goes through the basics of management, such as planning, leading, organizing, and controlling. There is also some other stuff that is very interesting. Generally speaking, the content is practical and interesting.

Topic 1: Info and history
Topic 2: External environment
Topic 3: Organisational culture
Topic 4: Decision-making
Topic 5: Planning
Topic 6: Organising
Topic 7: Motivation
Topic 8: Leadership
Topic 9: Control
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor was very passionate about teaching. He enjoyed discussing questions with students during lessons. He has quite a heavy accent. But once you get used to it it won't be a problem.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is very very very good in this course. In fact, it is so lenient. The instructor said as long as you wrote something and it made sense (mid-term or final exam), he would give you a mark. Therefore, even if you are not sure, just write something. For class participation, you have to raise your hand and answer the instructor's questions during lessons.  

Class Participation 10%
Group Presentation  25%  
Mid-term  30%
Final  35%

My grade:
Class participation: Not sure, but I answered 1 question per lesson (in most cases)
Group presentation: 92/100
Mid-term: 98/100 (mean: 78.91, SD: 13.95, median:81)
Final: 100/100 (mean: 80.15, SD: 17.64, median: 83)
Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload:
You have to do a project and give a presentation. You should also attend all lectures in order to get participation marks. However, these things are very easy to do. For my team, we spent a week doing the project and we did it relaxingly. So there are many things to do, but it is not difficult to do all of them.

P.S We could not choose our own teammates.

reviews.author: ustisfun
reviews.title: Trash course, unfair grading
reviews.comment_content: Similar content with MGMT 2110 - common sense + business sense would be sufficient for this course. If you're a business student then do go for it
reviews.comment_teaching: Pavel's always encourage students to answer questions, which is good because there's participation for this course
reviews.comment_grading:
Super enraged by this. Groupmates are randomly decided so life or death depends on it.

Midterm: (mean 79, SD 13.95, median 81)
Finals:  (mean 80, SD 17.64, median 83)
Presentation: (mean 85.05, SD 9.55, median 88)
Participation should be maxed out since I answered questions in every lesson

probably got fucked by the presentation
reviews.comment_workload: ok la, just revisions and presentation.

reviews.author: PNWolf
reviews.comment_content:
-Introduction and History of Mgmt
-Managing the external environment
-Organizational Culture
-Decision Making
-Planning
-Organizing
-Motivation
-Leadership
-Controlling
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching style is super good. He discusses the different models of Management with the class and talks a lot about negative aspects of the models.
Additionally he has a great example for literally everything he talks about. This makes the lectures actually pretty interesting and you memorize the points he makes easily.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation 10%
Group Presentation 25%
Mid-term 30%
Final 35%

You really have to pay attention in class in order to get a Participation card every single lecture, but it is possible.
If you pay attention in class and create a good Cheatsheet the Exams should be no problem.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is easy. No homework and not much preparation for the exams needed. But you have to be in every lecture.

reviews.author: Humphrey
reviews.title: Good course, easy course
reviews.comment_content: The content was not difficult. You could pick up easily even with or without business background. Besides, just raise the hand a few more times and get the bonus card. You could do it. Be punctual to attend the class
reviews.comment_teaching: He teaches quite good but need t be improved. Strong accent. However, he loves this course and teach in a fun way
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is not transparent. We don't know how does he grade.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload not much. Just midterm and final. Not need to worry about the homework.

reviews.author: briantsangg
reviews.comment_content:
This course provides students with a systematic approach to acquiring a solid foundation in the principles of management. Our journey begins with an introduction of what management is and the history of management. Then, we will explore the external environment and internal environment under which managers do their jobs. Quite literally, organizations operate by managers making decisions, thus we will next examine how managers make decisions. The rest of the course is organized around the four functions of management, namely planning (defining organizational goals and establishing strategies), organizing (structuring work activities), leading (influencing and motivating people), and controlling (monitoring and correcting organizational performance).
Course Objectives for Students
On completion of this course, you should be able to:
• Compare and contrast major schools of thought in the evolution of management theory
• Describe the external environment facing a manager, and explain its influences on the
manager’s work
• Describe an organization’s culture, and explain how this culture is formed and maintained
• Apply the rational approach of decision making, and discuss common biases in decision
making
reviews.comment_teaching: 專心上堂記下上堂講過嘅examples就ok
reviews.comment_grading:
有兩個quiz
可以有一張cheat sheet
但基本上唔難
reviews.comment_workload: 冇乜，得閒答吓問題就ok

reviews.author: heheitsme
reviews.title: pretty competitive
reviews.comment_content: they just taught the basics- half of it is covered in the Intro to OB MGMT course so great cc for sbm kids.
reviews.comment_teaching: since they are PhD students teaching the course, they seem to be a bit more chill and interactive in the classes. However, if you aren't a fan of participating in class, best look for another class because 50% of the class is just participating.
reviews.comment_grading: the course is quite competitive and subjective. for group presentation, one of the instructors loved our presentation yet the whole presentation did poorly because the other instructor, who didnt give us comments earlier, hated it.
reviews.comment_workload: the work load is not too much compared to other mgmt courses- a typical group presentation and two exams. it's easier of you have good teammates but not necessary.

reviews.author: Shady
reviews.title: Good Introduction to Management
reviews.comment_content:
PART 1

Introduction to management
What is strategic management
External analysis

External analysis
Internal analysis

Strategy formulation tools (1)

Strategy formulation tools (2)

Organizational design and strategy implementation

Contemporary strategic topics  

PART 2

Motivation

Personality and emotion

Decision making

Leadership

Groups, teams, and diversity

Human resource management

Good content overall. The 2 parts are independent from one another. Both are quite useful to know and understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
This course was in taught by PhD candidates this summer. Both have performed an admirable job in conducting classes and preparing notes.  Each part has one instructor teaching it independently from the other.

They are friendly in class and let all students answer questions. They are also responsive to mails
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance - 10%
Participation - 15%

Midterm - 25%

Project - 25%

Final Exam - 25%

The Final Exam is not cumulative. It only covers Part 2 of the course syllabus. Likewise, the midterm exam only covers Part 1 of the syllabus. Thus there are effectively 2 midterms.
The exams have 2 parts each : Multiple Choice Questions and Essay Questions

The final project is a group presentation wherein we analyse an episode of the show Undercover Boss assigned to us

There are points for attendance and missing classes can dock those points. Similarly, it is also imperative to answer in class in order to get the full participation score.

The grading is great overall. The course is quite competitive, which leads to high mean scores in the exams and project.

Final Grade : A+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is alright for a summer course. Not too heavy. But a lot of content is covered in 4 weeks. The project coupled with 2 exams can be mildly challenging to handle

reviews.author: zorro
reviews.title: introvert, dont reg this class
reviews.comment_content: easy content, layman wording, actually you can just start study the content a few days before the exam and you can nail it.
reviews.comment_teaching: strong accent drom the prof, hard to stay concentrate at all, as you cannot pick up what he said easily.
reviews.comment_grading: poor grading, at least not good in the point of an introvert. one sd above mean in mt, mean at the final exam, one sd above mean regarding the group presentation, not an active speaker in the class, result in a B. Introverts, just don't reg this class/ this prof.
reviews.comment_workload: not huge per se, but my groupmate is demanding, which lea to huge workload. the 2 exams are writing competition, just through some words or key concept will be fine.

reviews.author: hahaha123xd
reviews.title: Pavel is a good professor
reviews.comment_content:
Content is manageable, easy to understand for students from all schools. Covers all aspects of management i.e. controlling, planning, organizing and leading. Syllabus content is as follows:

1: Foundation and history of management
2: Managing the external environment
3: Organizational culture
4: Decision making
5: Planning and strategy
6: Organizational structure
7: Motivation
8: Leadership
9: Controlling
10. Lululemon case study

Midterm exam covers chapters 1-5; Final exam covers chapters 6-9. Exams are non-cumulative. Topic 10 is for counting participation marks, it is not examined

Above exams, there is one group project in which you have to watch a youtube video of 1 hour in length and conduct a 15-minute presentation on management issues identified. Not challenging at all.
reviews.comment_teaching: Pavel teaches well, he is responsive to questions asked in class and asked through emails. He provides detailed answers. He is also quite savage at times, which I like haha. Overall, a decent professor, concepts are well explained
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair. Pretty sure this course is curved. Pavel will talk about potential areas to be examined during lesson time, you will know as long as you are attentive. I would say higher effort does result in higher grade, since exam questions are not difficult but require you to be familiar with the content. Time is quite tight so do the questions quickly. Rubrics as follows

Class Participation 10%
Group Presentation 25%
Mid-term 30%
Final 35%

For participation, answer one question per 2 lessons can already help you score a good mark. Typing answers in the chatbox also count so just copy and paste what others typed.
For group presentation, as long as you present stuff logically, relate course content with the content in the video, you will receive a decent score. Q&A session is chill.

My statistics are as follows:
Mid-term: 100/100 (Mean: 81.36, sd: 15.73)
Final: 100/100 (Mean: 82.92, sd: 14.82)
Project: 24/25 (Mean: 21.71, sd: 1.76)
No idea about my participation mark, given my participation in class, I guess I would receive at least an 8/10.

Final grade: A+
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is light, no assignments, exams are not difficult. One thing to note is about projects though. Make sure you have good teammates and pray for them since groupings are randomized and decision is made by the TAs. I am lucky that while my teammates do not have a solid business and case analysis background, they are not freeriders and are willing to contribute. Yet, since grouping is simply based on luck, I once again advise you to pray for good teammates.

reviews.author: 太陽個仔
reviews.title: Good Grade CC
reviews.comment_content:
Course Schedule
Introduction to OBPersonality, Emotions, & Values
June 24Motivation

July 1No Class –Tuen Ng Festival
July 3Leadership, Power, & Influence

July 10External AnalysisIndividual Project Due
July 13Internal Analysis
July 15Strategy Formulation (1)

July 20International Strategy
July 22Organizational Design and Strategy Implementation
July 29Group Assignment Due
reviews.comment_teaching: I can't tag the name of the professors, they are Xinhao (Jamie), Qiao and Soljee Susie Lee. 幾fun,會分享生活d野instead of 讀ppt.
reviews.comment_grading:
Course Evaluation
1.Attendance15% （頭5分鐘計）
2.Participation15% （發言次數）
3.Individual Project35%
4. Group Project35%
Total100%

For me:
Attendance 15/15
parti 15/15
individual project 27/30 :
Turning in the news article by the due date (5/5 points)
Meeting the 5-page limit (1/1 point)
Addressing all the sections (Summary of the article, OB theory explanations, Application of the theories, Recommendation) (1/1 point)
Formatting (APA, double-space, font & font size, 1-inch margins) (1/1 point)
Turning in the project by the due date (1/1 point)
Turn-it-in match (1/1 point)
Content of the summary (2/2 points)
Content of the OB theories (5/7 points)
Content of the application (6/7 points)
Content of the recommendation (4/4 points)

group project 33/35
(NO SD AND MEAN PROVIDED)
Final Grade A+
reviews.comment_workload:
Summer sem嚟講workload 都幾大，每一三五朝早上3個鐘，仲要頭果5分鐘已經計attendance 。
由於佢冇mid term, final.
佢主要做兩篇文，一篇individual 要寫5 page , 一篇group 寫10page . Group 嗰篇如果要寫得好，要不斷開會去諗吓用邊個Analysis同埋點樣改啲字眼問題，所以都大workload.

reviews.author: sehunbaby
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is more like common sense, so it is not too difficult to handle
reviews.comment_teaching: A bit boring but he is a good professor, and he always encourage us to voice our opinions in class
reviews.comment_grading: Because the final exam is cancelled, so the grade is for project and mid-term exam. The cut-off is very high for this course, so even if you study hard, you may not secure an A range. Attendence is also one of the criteria for the final grade.Also, try to answer more questions in class.
reviews.comment_workload: There isn't much workload to be honest, as we don't have to memorise details for the exams

reviews.author: C8H9NO2
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1: Foundation and history of management
Topic 2: Managing the external environment
Topic 3: Organizational culture
Topic 4: Decision making
Topic 5: Planning and strategy
Topic 6: Organizational structure
Topic 7: Motivation
Topic 8: Leadership
Topic 9: Controlling

There is nothing too difficult to understand, which is good for non-SBM student.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is good. Prof. Li is nice to students and tries to engage everyone in the class. Concepts were clearly explained.
reviews.comment_grading:
Attendance 5%
Participation 5%
Group presentation (slideshow) 25%
Midterm 30%
Final 35% (was cancelled, grading was based on other assessments listed above)

Grading was fairly good since my score for midterm and group presentation were just slightly above mean but I got A at the end. People in the class got very similar score for each assessment because the contents were not difficult. This perhaps means that attendance and participation made differences. I attended almost all classes and participated in the conversation every time (you need to be active in class in order to get participation score.)
reviews.comment_workload: I didn't study particularly hard for this course. Compared to many CCC that need a lots of effort and time, I feel like this course is relatively relaxing. You just need to review the slides for exam and preparing presentation.

reviews.author: smart123456
reviews.title: Good grade CC
reviews.comment_content: Its all about the introduction of management which is what a manager has to do. For example, how the manager makes a decision and lead the company well. It also includes what is a organizational culture of a company which will affect the employees' working performance. Don't worry about these things if u r not a business student because that's quite common sense and it's easy to follow the lessons.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think he teaches quite well and he will ask students to answer questions quite often for participation marks.
reviews.comment_grading: quite good
reviews.comment_workload: no assignments and only exams and one project.

reviews.author: Ying_AAA
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction
(1) History of management
(2) Organizational culture personality
(3) Decision making (biases, processes, outcomes)
(4) Motivation emotions at work
(5) Leadership teams and groups
(6) Managing the external environment
(7) Planning, strategy and competitive advantage
(8) International strategy
(9) Organizational structure
(10) Control
reviews.comment_teaching: Two instructors, each taught 5 lessons. There were games related to decision making, control. Pretty fun. A lot of group discussions. Attendance was taken before and after the class. Instructors were nice, always willing to answer your questions. Overall was good.
reviews.comment_grading:
Group presentation evaluation criteria
1. Identification and description of important management issues 20%
2. Analysis of underlying causes 20%
3. Generation and evaluation of alternative actions 40%
Description of recommendation 10%
4. Presentation skills 10%

Overall grading
30 students, around 20% A-range
reviews.comment_workload:
1. Attendance 10%
2. Class participation 10%
3. Group presentation 20%
4. Test 1 30%
5. Test 2 30%

reviews.author: Goldthread
reviews.title: Great course for non-business students
reviews.comment_content: Introduction to management, as title suggested the prof touched on topics that are introductory to non-business student, concepts are very easy to understand and quite useful.
reviews.comment_teaching: This class is the first class I had in use as I took in on Monday 9:00 am, and it leaves a very good impression indeed. The prof is very passionate and nice, he is also very helpful and do his best to answer your question. His teaching is also very nice and definitely won't make it bored to have his lesson. He has a fatherly-like impression as he really takes care of everyone's needs.
reviews.comment_grading: I didn't study extremely hard for this course, just read all the reading material before the exam and that's it, and still got a pretty satisfactory grading.
reviews.comment_workload: Have a group project, which required bit of a work, but the topic is quite easy and interesting as it just requires you to watch an episode of a reality show then talks about the management problem and solution in there, if you got good group mates you can even make some new friends.

reviews.author: pizzachu
reviews.title: Easy Common Core Course For All School Students
reviews.comment_content:
Mostly common sense, not really difficult, but not that useful at the same time.
Learning about macro- and micro-management ways, I think the micro part is some about psychology, like why will people willing to do something and use the causes of the motivation to manage, the macro part is more about theory.
For me, the micro part is easier to understand and personal, it is about personality, decision making, diversity and ethics, and motivation.
The macro part is about the external environment and competition, internal capabilities, goal setting and cooperation social responsibility, governance, and cooperate communications.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Taught by two post-grad students, one is more interactive learning, the other one is kinda boring as he just gives us so many info. by saying but not demonstrating.
I am okay with both ways of teaching, but to be honest, with interactions and demonstrations make students more willing to learn and remember things more clearly and with stronger memorization.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% - Test 1 (the first half)
30% - Test 2 (the second half)
20% - Group Presentation
10% - Attendance
10% - Participation
The grading is not bad, I got 7x% and 6x% for the tests, both are below the mean, I did not know about the marks of the presentation but I think at least 50% I got, and I should have full marks for attendance and participation, and I got a B-.
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework, just 2 tests as the mid-term and final exam, some non-grading quizzes at the start of every lesson for attendance and reminders of what has taught the last lesson, those quizzes are easy and some of the questions will be on the test. Therefore, attending lessons on time will save you from the testes.
The teachers encourage us to buy the book for the lesson but I do not think that it is necessary, revising the materials they gave will be enough for the testes.

reviews.author: VTN
reviews.title: MGMT 1110
reviews.comment_content:
The content is fairly straight forward and can be understood using common sense. However, there are many new terms to remember.

Professor may give you some real life examples and videos during classes which may help you for your mid term and final exam.

Midterm:
Introduction to management
Managing the external environment
Organisational Culture
Decision Making

Final:
Planning and strategic management
Organisational structure
Motivation
Leadership
Controlling
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor teaches very clear and always encourages students to participate in class. (He makes it easy to get full marks on participation)
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Participation: 10%
Group Presentation 30%
Mid term: 30%
Final 30%

Class participation: Attend all lectures and try to answer or ask 3 questions every class to attain full marks.

Group presentation: You get good mark as long as you follow the instructions given.

Mid term/Final Exam: You will achieve a good grade as long as you thoroughly study through the lecture notes.

(As mid term and final exam is quite easy, most people get the same scores, so it is important to excel in group presentation and participation if you are aiming for A range)
reviews.comment_workload: Group presentation, attendance and class participation.

reviews.author: DCTw
reviews.title: an average course
reviews.comment_content:
content is simple since it's an introduction.but i personally like the content of mgmt courses
people can learn from notes easily, but the prof does iprs as taking attendance.
reviews.comment_teaching:
not bad but boring teaching.
prof is actually passionate and nice.
he is always positive to students.
reviews.comment_grading: take a look at notes before mid-term and final, then your grade will be fine. but they do count the participation mark.
reviews.comment_workload: not very heavy, unless all your groupmates for the grp report are free-riders. but the report is not complicated at all.

reviews.title: Great Course!
reviews.comment_content: The content is interesting for both business and non-business students. You can learn basic management concepts and terminology.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor speaks fluent English and his class is no boring at all.  He asks inspiring questions during classes and let students to think and remember concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is great.  For people who are not very hard working, understand all concepts in the notes and you can get a B.  If you want an A, you must frequently answer questions during class, ask questions during other group's presentation and remember examples in the notes.


The mean is very high in midterm and exam.

There is attenance with iPRS.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is a project, a midterm and a final exam.  The workload of the project is not too much, just watch a video and analysis it with what you learned in class.  Make a good powerpoint and speak well during the presentation is fine.  

The contents appeared in the midterm does not appear in final.  Just understand all the concepts in the notes and choose the best option with your common sense and logic in the exams.

reviews.author: Alanauacl
reviews.comment_content: The content is easy to understand
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is really nice and is willing to help students.
reviews.comment_grading:
Participation=10%
Midterm=30%
Project=30%
Final=30%

Participation: IPRS+ have to answers questions if you want to have a good grade

Midterm: Mean is high, for MC it's 20.9/27 with an sd of 2.xx. Essay's mean is 20/24 with an sd of 2.xx

Final: Mean is high too, for MC it's 25.5/32 and essay is 25.5/28

Midterm is important, my group mate who get the same project mark and a slightly higher overall score than me in final only get a B. His midterm is mean while my midterm is 26/27 for MC and 21/24 for the essay. My final for MC is  24/32 and 28/28 for essay. I get 85 for project. But I get A at the end. I think our parti mark show only a small difference. So you must do very well in midterm
reviews.comment_workload:
Nearly no workload

For both midterms and finals, all you have to do is to memorize all the lectures notes given. The MC is easy and for the essay questions, just write as many as you can.

reviews.author: gazelle
reviews.title: a highly recommended cc
reviews.comment_content: Basic business concepts related to everyday life are taught. Students with advanced business background might find some concepts overlap with other business courses (e.g. unbounded rationality, red queen effect, black swan event, merger and acquisition, etc). Indeed, nearly one third of the course content is about psychology. Business management and decisions are often related to psychology. Taking SOSC 1960 at the same time might also help you better understand the inter-relation among human behavior and business world.
reviews.comment_teaching:
There were three instructors for this course -- John Jamison, Arden Leung, and Andy Yun.

John Jamison was responsible for the first half of the course. He is a difficult and creative thinker who always encourages us to think deeply and independently by asking some creative questions, which are worth pondering over. Even if you sit remain silent, not voicing out your opinions, you can still gain a lot listening to him and other classmates.

Arden Leung was one of the instructors who taught the second half. Comparatively, his lessons were less interesting. Yet, his presentations and explanations were clear, illustrated with numerous daily-life examples. Despite being informative, his lessons are of high quality.

Andy Yun was a Korean lecturer who gave the last few lessons. His Korean accent and not-proficient-enough English often hindered you from understanding. His presentation was not well-organised rather. Although he is knowledgeable and experienced in management field, his teaching is not most effective IMO (yet not disastrous at least).
reviews.comment_grading:
The lenient grading is most praiseworthy for this course.

Distribution of total score
20% exam 1
30% exam 2
30% group presentation
10% attendance
10% participation

The total score (not even individual items) was not released unfortunately. I performed quite satisfactorily in both exams (I guess both were >80%). Full attendance and constant participation. Yet, I thought I flunked out in the group presentation. There were some professional and impressing groups but ours was only of mediocre quality. I predicted to get a B-/B originally. Luckily, it turned out to be A-, which fulfilled my goal when I decided to take this course. I guess no people got C range for this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
I would say there is not much to do in this course.
Throughout the semester, what you need to do is to pay attention and think carefully during lesson. At home, revise the concepts in lecture notes thoroughly. The exam is not that tricky when you are familiar with those concepts. Plus, the two exams only contain 50 MCQs. No open-ended questions/ short essays are included.

For the group project, they will assign you into group and the video to be watched. Then, you have to identify the management problems in the video and propose some possible solutions. Apply what you have learnt in lessons will help. Not much details have to be elaborated since each group only has 10 minutes to give the presentation.

reviews.author: shaking
reviews.comment_content: pretty good and really learn a lot from that. as a fundamental course, teacher uses a lot of practical cases to illustrate the management basic concept and answer questions about career plan and management in a detailed way.
reviews.comment_grading: depends on teachers of mgmt. some teachers only give the 20% participation and the rest would be the exam performance but some teacher, like amy will use 10 class cases for the 60% participation grades.
reviews.comment_workload: not the heavy but require our fresh students pay a lot attention to the basic concept (must know the common terms )

reviews.author: lacilaci
reviews.title: It's just okay
reviews.comment_content:
Motivation
Personality & Creativity
Organizational Behavior
Leadership Group and Teams
HR Culture
Business Ethics Emotions at Work
Organizational Structure
Organizational Theory
External Environment
Internal Capabilities Competitive Advantage
International Strategy
Strategic Planning 1
Strategic Planning 2

Not difficult for non-bossiness background students. Just some basic theories. Do not need to listen to the lecture. Review the lecture notes before exams.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Three pg researchers of UST.
Have some teaching experience.
Can give the lecture clearly.
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Examination 1 20%
2. Examination 2 30%
3. Group Presentation 30%
4. Attendance 10%
5. Participation 10%
Total 100%

Exams are just MC questions.
Group presentation--just 12 minutes for a group (4-5 people)
need to go to lecture to take the attendance

grade is quite good
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite small.
Review the lecture notes before exams.
Use several hours to prepare the presentation.

reviews.author: lhm
reviews.comment_content:
not a business student but the content is not hard to understand
some are interesting and can be used in daily life
videos will be played in the lesson and the content will be asked in the exams
reviews.comment_teaching:
fair
read powerpoint
always gives you time to discuss with your group mates and always asks questions
he is quite kind and is pleased to hear from your personal experience when you answer his questions
reviews.comment_grading:
attendance
you can still sign it even if you are late for like 30min
need to answer his questions to get a good grade
presentation is important too
reviews.comment_workload: only a project and the exams are in MC form

reviews.author: smile:)
reviews.title: Presentation is important
reviews.comment_content:
Content is relevant and down to earth. Not difficult but need to review the notes from time to time as there's quite a lot of slides.
The group project (around 6 per group) requires you to identify management problems,  offer solutions and most importantly to apply the concepts you have learnt in class. Very important to have good team mates!
take attendance every lesson
Active participation in class is needed (there is marks for that)
reviews.comment_teaching: He incorporate different real life examples into explaining management concepts and tries to engage students into classroom discussions. He is patient in listening to and responding to questions from students. However, his tone is quite boring which you may fall asleep easily if you don't participate in class. After all, he show sincerity and hard work in his teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term
MC
Mean: 23.5 High: 26 Low: 17
Essay
Mean: 21 High: 24 Low: 18

FINAL
MC
Mean: 25.5 High: 30 Low: 15
Essay
Mean: 25 High: 28 Low: 18

Presentation
Mean: 80.5 High: 95 Low: 68.4

Peer evaluation
Mean: 13.9 High: 16 Low: 4
reviews.comment_workload:
Not really demanding
only have 1 mid term and 1 final which is not cumulative
but really need to give best every time to got A-range as the marks differ is quite small.

reviews.author: ard
reviews.comment_content: Basic management theories that seem to have many applications. Interesting topics since psychology is also discussed
reviews.comment_teaching: Participation is encouraged as it a very interactive course. Ask questions!
reviews.comment_grading: The content is not necessarily the most interesting, but there is a weird way of grading. Some students find it is not completely fair because right answers are very subjective.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is similar to other business core classes. Some students struggled to finish while others did it in a couple of minutes. You can choose for yourself how much time to invest, but more time definitely means better grades because the teacher knows what to ask about.

reviews.author: HELLO:)
reviews.title: Good choice to be common core or minor business course:)
reviews.comment_content:
Different concepts of management are covered, e.g. management process, planning and strategy, organization structure, managerial leadership etc. The content is quite interesting as this somehow related to our daily lives.

Group project only requires the proposal and the presentation.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Wan is nice as he clearly explains the concepts by using different case studies. He will remember your name when you answer the questions he raised.

TA is willing to answer your questions and give you some opinion related to the group project.
reviews.comment_grading:
50% final exam
15% class participation (just make sure you have answered 15 questions he raised in the class and you can get all 15%!)
5% class attendance (maybe by iPRS after the voting of small presentation)
30% Group project (presentation)

The grade is quite good. I get all marks in attendance, I don't know what marks I got in the group project and final examination. I got B+:)
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not so heavy as you only need to deal with a group project and one final examination. In class, you can just listen to the lecture and have some class participation by raising hands and answering the questions.

reviews.author: Waha555
reviews.comment_content: This course teaches basic management theories and models, including planning, controlling, organisational culture and decision making, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor teaches well. He raises quite a lot of questions to encourage us expressing our ideas and views. He will also use different examples to explain those theories so that we can understand them easily.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is lenient, just understanding and memorising the notes is enough for the examination. It is quite easy to get an A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Take attendance via iprs, one midterm and final exam with MC and essay parts, one group project with 18 minutes presentation only

reviews.author: Maple
reviews.title: Suitable for beginners
reviews.comment_content: The course is main an introduction to classical management elements. Including planning, organizing, leading and controlling. The content is easily understood and can be considerate as common sense. Especially for BAFS students, the content is really similar and as long as you have logical thinking you are done. Thought, a little revision is needed as to memorize concepts before the exams.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The lecturers are PG students and they are really friendly and will answer every single question you ask.
Especially for non-business background students, you will be able to know every single concept during lessons, and can even ask after lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
As content is easy, the exam is also not difficult. For summer course, there was a lot of exchange students. Some of them are business student but mostly not, therefore the mean is just 84 out of 100. I got 91 and a B+ overall.
5-6 members,18 mins group presentation is simply applying concepts in case studies. Cases are drawn from the TV show "Undercover Boss". Most of the groups perform similarly so it doesn't makes any critical changes on your grades.
What matters is the participation score. Our lecturers will give out participation cards whenever you answer or ask meaningful questions. Number of cards will be counted at the end of semester. I was told that one of the classmate got 30 something, I believe I got almost 20.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is really light. Basically just revise a bit after every lecture and pay a little effort before exams.
Projects are easy, just ensure your group mates can finish their part before deadline and everything will be fine.
Mainly you should participate more during lesson.

reviews.author: Tornado
reviews.title: Harsh grading
reviews.comment_content: Great basic content about management. Manageable for everyone, especially great for those who had never touched into the field of management.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Great teaching. The participation cards did their jobs as they count your attendance and participation in class, which both of them calculate into the final grade.

The teachers would use vivid examples, YouTube videos to explain concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
We never know how he calculates the marks for the final and group project, so you can get a C range without knowing why.

Also, students tend to perform well in this course, so it is not easy to get good grades.
reviews.comment_workload: A Mid-term, a final and a group project are waiting for you. The workload is not huge, it's manageable, but definitely not the lightest.

reviews.author: lsylsy
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite useful and interesting, learned about basic theories and ideas regarding management. Some aspects of sociology/psychology was also included.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor teaches very well, tries to engage students and encourages participation. He is willing to answer any questions from students and tries his best to let students understand the course materials fully. The lecture patterns were similar (daily powerpoint presentations and notes given to students).
reviews.comment_grading: The professor is quite lenient when marking the exams. As long as you study the course materials, you should be able to do fine in midterm and final exams. Your marks can also be boosted if you attend all the classes and participate in class.
reviews.comment_workload: There was no homework, only midterm, final exam, and one group project. The group project may take quite some time but with good group members, it may be easy.

reviews.author: Rezzaldo
reviews.title: Good grade course but somewhat useless
reviews.comment_content:
Describes the principles of mgmt in 9 modules
Before midterm, it is abt each procedure of mgmt:
-planning
-controlling
-organising
-leading
After midterm, it focuses on the employer's charisma (and sometimes their interaction w/employees)

Very basic stuff, just memorise the concepts and elaborate. Since a lot of us should have approached mgmt (e.g. joining societies), it is not hard to understand them.
reviews.comment_teaching: Passionate prof. but since the content is basic, sometimes it's boring, so I guess he raises questions to attract our attention.
reviews.comment_grading:
Finals is slightly harder & more troublesome than that of midterm.
The project counts much.
Means for both midterm and finals are actually very high (like avg is ~3 marks away from full marks in essay), so don't make silly mistakes.
I think my group flunked the presentation but I don't know how the prof. graded us.

Got B+ in the end (but I would have got an A if I had done better in finals MC and/or in presentation T.T)
reviews.comment_workload:
ATTENDANCE COUNTS via answering PRS, although giving wrong answers doesn't deduct marks.
No assignments.
Has 1 midterm, 1 final, 1 group pre - can form groups on your own or wait till the TA groups you and the others.

reviews.author: SomeoneInUST2
reviews.comment_content: The content are all from PPTs instructor provided. Pretty easy to understand
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Li is a quite nice professor. He is always ready to answer all the questions students have. He always activates the atmosphere of the classroom by asking students questions.
Despite the fact above, the class is a bit boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Both mid-term and final exams are pretty easy so every one tends to have good exam scores. The grade largely depends on presentation and participation.
We had PRS everyday as well so that counts.
reviews.comment_workload: Nearly no workload. However if you and your groupmates want to present well during the final presentation, your guys have to work hard.

reviews.author: Reco
reviews.comment_content: The contents are really easy to understand and the defintions are on the PPTs so it's not neccessary to write down the notes, and the PPT slices are printed and you can get them every lesson.
reviews.comment_teaching: Li Qiang is a very passionate and nice teacher. he is always ready to answer your questions and if you have problem about the presentaions don't hesitate to get help.
reviews.comment_grading: mid term and finals are really easy, final are a little bit more difficult than the mid term. and just understand the PPTs, you will achieve a good grade. there is attendance part so be like to ask questions and answer questions because it counts an additional10%.
reviews.comment_workload: there is no work load if the attendance multiple choice doesnt count.

reviews.author: Rui Lin
reviews.comment_content: The content was really basic and I don't find anything that sparked my interest towards management.
reviews.comment_teaching: Alan is a really nice and flexible lecturer but I wouldn't say he is a good in teaching. When students answer questions for the sake of getting the participation cards, he will openly accept all their answers despite it being somehow ridiculous at times. Since there isn't right or wrong, I had a really vague understanding throughout this course.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was way too lenient which can be good and bad at the same time. Good because you have the chance to score really high and vice versa.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload was pretty okay considering that you have good groupmates who doesn't free ride you.

reviews.author: thatperson
reviews.title: Interesting and fun course
reviews.comment_content: General knowledge regarding the basics of management. Analyses various companies' management skills and go in depth about the culture,environment,etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof STAM Wouter is one of the best professor i've ever met. He has tons of examples in his slides and supplements his lectures well. He is also helpful and patient, willing to help any student who has problems with the lecture. His teaching style might sometimes be boring but he makes up for it by interacting with students on the spot.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is actually normal on contrary to the 'good grade' rumour. However, if you are willing to work hard and understand all the content, you will have no problem get B or above. However, take notice of the group presentation(30%) since its weighting is higher than the exams(27.5% each). There are also quizzes on the case studies provided by prof.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not much. Only has presentation and quizzes to finish. Overall, workload is close to none.

reviews.author: LordQD
reviews.comment_content:
The lecture content is very appropriate as it provides all the introductory materials to management to those who have no background in the field. I personally enjoyed learning management concepts, which are always backed with real-life evidence.  The contents include:
Foundations and history of management
Managing the external environment
Organizational culture
Decision making
Planning and strategy
Organizational structure
Motivation
Leadership
and Controlling.

Each of these concepts are unique but interconnected so knowing one concept will allow you to easily use the concept to understand another. In addition, case studies are provided, and it must be learnt (and bought, due to copyright fees), as quizzes will be held on those topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor's teaching content is great as the presentations are well prepared and useful when revising for exams. However, I recommend you to borrow the textbook from the library as it is needed if you want to score high on the exams. The professor also shows videos of real life situations of applied managerial techniques or flawed managerial techniques, which make the class more interesting. There is also a break during the lecture, which is very pleasing.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is based on 1 midterm 27.5%
1 final 27.5%, class participation 10.0%, case quizzes 5.0%, and group presentation 30.0%
The exams consist of multiple choice questions and long answered short essay questions.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is fair. Besides studying for exams, there is a group project, which is usually in groups of 5 or 6 people, and you can choose your group mates.

reviews.author: Hi!It'sme
reviews.title: Present應該好重要
reviews.comment_content:
教management既基本野，都係d common sense.
圍繞organizational culture, structure, decision-making, control等等既野
完全唔難既
reviews.comment_teaching:
stam好搞笑，堂上會播片。
一星期一堂，每堂3個鐘
教d concept好生活化，好多例子。
考試都係應用d concepts比suggestion同分析問題。
attendance
reviews.comment_grading:
我拎左c+。 正常應該人人可以係A range左右，不過我知道我地組present炒左，超左時間同present得一般，加上d 播片同ppt入電腦時有techinical problems搞左好耐。雖然midterm below mean 幾分，但個TA話其實最重要都係present既內容，而且考試大家都差不多水準，除左個別好高分之外。final同midterm都係佔27。5%，present就30%，present我地應該低分。
唔係business學生，要小心present，早d預備。
reviews.comment_workload:
有幾次quiz,唔難，
midterm&final 分別27.5%
present 30% （好重要，應該係用黎分grading。）

reviews.author: Vanessa
reviews.title: A pretty good course for business students
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty interesting
The most important is to  understand the concepts
Two exams and one group presentation
reviews.comment_teaching: There are two professors. Ms. Jennifer (Xin Wang) is the first professor. She gave us good examples and taught us well. The sevond professor, Mr. prasad Chandrashekar has a husky voice, we can hardly hear him. And his eyes are so red. When we ask him questions in the lesson,  sometimes he just skip it when he doesn't know how to answer it.
reviews.comment_grading: I got an A . I think it is because of the presentation, our group got the highest mark.
reviews.comment_workload:
No homework
Originally there is a written report but then it was cancelled

reviews.author: wksm
reviews.title: somehow Y1 busi core學嘅野翻炒
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1: Foundation and history of management
Topic 2: Managing the external environment
Topic 3: Organizational culture
Topic 4: Decision making
Topic 5: Planning and strategy
Topic 6: Organizational structure
Topic 7: Motivation
Topic 8: Leadership
Topic 9: Controlling
Case study: Lululemon case （我skip曬兩堂CS lol）
reviews.comment_teaching:
accent需要少少時間習慣，但係
一開頭話ppt係教曬先post（佢會係上堂前update ppt）之後妥協左喺上堂前比provisional ppt我地
ppt好詳細，口頭會講examples同延伸野所以要jot notes
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Participation 10%
Group Presentation 25%
Mid-term 30%
Final 35%

最後A grade
reviews.comment_workload:
雖然9點堂會有少少難focus，但係有interactive嘅discussions（計parti），所以盡量早起啦...

group係random編嘅，會研究Undercover Boss某一集嘅內容然後present返個company嘅management issues同比recommendations
有唔記得MBA定PhD做advisor，都好nice好積極比advice我地:)
但係我嘅gm係shit... lol

reviews.author: lowtiertea
reviews.title: Intro to College Course
reviews.comment_content:
With this course, you'll get to understand the nitty-gritty of business management.
The syllabus is attached below.

If you're a freshman student, this would be the perfect course for you to experience lectures in a college context.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Pavel is great and kind.
You'll do better with active listening, and think more rather than rote memorization.
Find TA if you need any help.
reviews.comment_grading:
It's fair grading. Your effort does reflect on the grade.
The mid-term exam and final exam are non-cumulative.
Don't expect to grind a super high grade though, since everyone's equally competitive.
reviews.comment_workload:
It's super light in terms of workload.
There's only one single presentation and the TA will help you a lot.

reviews.author: axy
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting and useful content. Some of the contents are related to BAFS Dse syllabus.

Topic 1: Foundation and history of management
Topic 2: Managing the external environment
Topic 3: Organizational culture
Topic 4: Decision making
Topic 5: Planning and strategy
Topic 6: Organizational structure
Topic 7: Motivation
Topic 8: Leadership
Topic 9: Controlling
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor always encourage students to answer the question and he is very patient to answer all questions.
reviews.comment_grading: Unknown (cancelled final examination, changed the weighting due to the social movement)
reviews.comment_workload: Medium workload if u find good teammates that would not freeride. There is quite a lot of freerider in my group, thus I devoted lots of effort and time on the project ( one week times), which is actually ridiculous.

reviews.author: Kevin KAI
reviews.title: I DON'T LIKE THIS COURSE
reviews.comment_content: The content is easy. many things are common senses. you just need to remember some specific words. it's ok.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Li Qiang is a good instructor. He can explain things clearly. it's easy to understand all the things after his teaching. He also try to encourage students to answer questions.
But don't choose his lesson at 9:00 because his voice makes nearly fall asleep in the morning.
reviews.comment_grading:
I don't like this grade because i think i really pay more efforts.
I try my best in presentation, and also try to answer questions in every single lesson.
finally,
i get 16/20 in participation, good, but i don't know whether it works.
the presentation is about 1 SD above the mean.
i didn't do well in two exams. because this exam everyone's mark is so close. in one part, it shows that the exam is really easy to handle. but in the other part, it shows that hardly can you make a difference between you and others.
i get nearly mean in midterm and a little bit below mean in final exam.
finally i get B+ but i really want to get A range. remember: if you are willing to get a good grade, go away, this course is not suitable for you
reviews.comment_workload: no workload

reviews.author: kimchi
reviews.title: A pretty good common course
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1: Foundation and history of management
Topic 2: Managing the external environment e.g. PESTEL framework, Porter's five forces
Topic 3: Organisational culture e.g. VUCA, dimensions of OCP, unfreeze-change-freeze model, J&Js
Topic 4: Decision making e.g. reasoning, intuition, perfect rationality, EBM, bounded rationality
Topic 5: Planning and strategy e.g. BCG matrix, SWOT analysis, SMART goals, top-down scenario planning
Topic 6: Organisational structure e.g. simple structure, functional structure, mechanistic and organic, matrix
Topic 7: Motivation e.g. equity theory, job characteristics model, expectancy theory
Topic 8: Leadership e.g. 5 bases of power, big five personality model, leadership qualities & styles
Topic 9: Control e.g. balanced scorecard, formal control VS informal control, feedforward control and concurrent control and feedback control
reviews.comment_teaching:
Pavel might be slightly boring at certain times but I have attended face-to-face lesson so it was fine actually, not bad
He explains with examples and with reference to other companies and makes sure you understand what he is talking about
reviews.comment_grading:
10% class participation (yeah it's a lot)
25% group presentation
30% mid-term
35% final

Haven't received the final grade when writing this review but I doubt it's going to be very bad...at least B or above
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light in my opinion there are no homework and all you have to do is speak up in class whenever appropriate or just type in the chat box as frequently as you can so the TA can see your name always popping up
Met decent groupmates for the presentation so we nailed it
Mid-term: make sure you can think of at least one example for every concept learnt and try to brainstorm what kind of questions will be asked for management courses because there is no past-paper
Final: same preparation as mid-term but try to do some more extra research on the material like the disadvantages and advantages or limitations of certain business models...a good source would be Harvard Business Review

reviews.author: 牌牌
reviews.comment_content: I personally think the content is good enough. Everything is a simple concept but they are practical in real life as well. However, I think real life situation definitely will be much more complicated than the content taught in this course. This course is the only intro to management so everything makes sense and easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is not bad. But yes, kind of boring, since you can literally understand everything for just reading all the slides.

And when Prof. Li starts his discussion and waiting for students to answer, I found out actually many students technically answer the same content to one question and this process just repeat again and again because Professor hopes all of us can try to join the discussion. But it just makes me more sleepy.

Prof. Li is a really good teacher after all. I think he tries his best to teach this course well.
reviews.comment_grading:
30% Midterm
30% Group presentation
30% Final
10% IPRS and class participation
Grading is very lenient.
Got the highest score in presentation (almost +2.5 SD)
A little above that mean on both mid-term and final exam (+0.5 SD I think)
So total I got almost +3.0 SD and got an A.

The only thing I would like to mention is to try to engage in the class discussion as much as possible. It will give you many bonuses and there is not limited for bonuses. I don't know they are useful or not though since I only raised my hand and answer professor's question for once.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is super light compared to the workload of any other courses I take.

No homework. Just simply attend the lecture and understand the concepts before taking the exam. Try to control the flow of your presentation and make everything simple. Simpler is better, but make sure that let everyone understand your point.

reviews.author: Genisusl
reviews.title: Bad Grade CC for non-busi student
reviews.comment_content:
Topic 1: Introduction & History
Topic 2: External Environment
Topic 3: Organizational Culture
Topic 4: Decision Making
Topic 5: Planning
Topic 6: Organizing
Topic 7: Motivation
Topic 8: Leadership
Topic 9: Control
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture:
-唔計attendance, 不過計class participation
-唔使compulsory買書, 用PowerPoint教書
-Pavel 哈佛博士, 又喺McKinsey做過野, 真係有D料到, 好着重啲detail位
-口音有啲難catch up, 講得high起上嚟會lur埋一舊🤦🏻‍♀️🤦🏻‍♀️
-會叫我哋開cam, answer chat box d問題, 着重interaction
- 冇tutorial

btw TA都幾好人, 仲好靚女🤤🤤
reviews.comment_grading:
Class Participation: 10%
Group Presentation: 25%
Midterm: 30%
Final: 35%

Me:
Class Participation: 冇講
Group Presentation: 24/25 (mean: 21.72/30, median: 22, sd: 1.76)
Midterm: 40.5/100 (mean: 81.36/100, median: 86/100 sd: 15.73 )
Final: 68/100 (mean: 81.2/100, median: 88 sd: 14.82 )
Letter Grade: C-

-如果唔讀busi, 千祈唔好揀呢個cc, 一定會俾班busi屈機
-(For non-busi student)真係reg左, 唔好用ssci/ engg ga mindset去溫書, 唔係一定炒得
reviews.comment_workload:
冇assignment, 有group project

Group Project:
-睇一集UnderCover Boss, US Reality Show, 根據入面嘅商業問題, 做一份proposal
-今個sem Zoom, 會assign groupmate俾你, 所以就真係好睇運氣
-TA幫你睇一睇份proposal

Class Participation:
-唔計attendance, 不過計class participation according to the contribution of chat box in Zoom
-其實都唔使太理, 因為全部人都差唔多分, 除非上堂係好outstanding la

Midterm/ Final (not cumulative):
-Upload word file
-上堂會講解返answer
-用Zoom監考, 要影住樣

好重要要講3次
如果唔讀busi, 千祈唔好揀呢個cc, 一定會俾班busi屈機
如果唔讀busi, 千祈唔好揀呢個cc, 一定會俾班busi屈機
如果唔讀busi, 千祈唔好揀呢個cc, 一定會俾班busi屈機

reviews.author: 123Ernest
reviews.title: MGMT 1110　轉左人教
reviews.comment_content: 一般management skill, 但係一堂教太多。如果上堂唔聽書，最後先溫書會追得好辛苦，但易追
reviews.comment_teaching:
Mr.Stam會問你問題，基本上係一D 上堂教既野，同埋common sense

Spring SEM開始會轉左人教
reviews.comment_grading: C-踩MEAN 我估因為Mr.Stam 返HOLAND 所以第二個派ＧＲＡＤＥ　先咁爛
reviews.comment_workload: 無功課，最尾有個group project，有人CARRY 就唔洗怕
